main event: A large and/or pencil-shaped object was seen to the south at an altitude of 45 degrees in Battle Creek, Michigan. The object remained stationary and gradually faded out over a 3-minute observation period.
interesting points: The object was described as large and/or pencil-shaped, and it remained stationary for 3 minutes before gradually fading out.
The report suggests that the observer may have mistaken the exhaust from a jet aircraft for the object, attributing the color and gradual fade-out to support this hypothesis.
The weather at the time of the sighting was described as having a thin overcast with excellent visibility.
There was only one object observed, and it appeared to be stationary throughout the sighting.
The observer was a 39-year-old purchasing agent from Battle Creek, Michigan.
